etymology.description: phonetic: 共(共) (gòng, 'together') + semantic: 己(己) (jǐ, 'oneself') = combining paths for oneself -> alley
etymology.interpretation: 巷(巷) (xiàng, 'alley') uses 共(共) (gòng, 'together') to phonetically suggest a shared space, while 己(己) (jǐ, 'oneself') implies a path for personal passage. The character embodies the concept of a personal path running through communal areas, hence an alley.

examples.chinese: 这条巷很窄(這條巷很窄)。
夜色降临时(夜色降臨時)，巷子里传来了笑声(巷子裡傳來了笑聲)。
examples.pinyin: Yèsè jiànglín shí, xiàngzi lǐ chuán lái le xiàoshēng.
examples.english: As night falls, laughter can be heard from the alley.
